title: Rounded geometric sans with slab "i" and "l"
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053829im_/http:/typophile.com/files/57f569e47828788958dd50dabd3d7cec_4114.jpg)

I noticed this rounded geometric sans in a Behance gallery. Single-story "a" and "g", with unusual slab and monospace-like "i" and "l".  
There are three more posters using it here: [1](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053829/http:/images.cdn.bigcartel.com/bigcartel/product_images/123834672/max_h-1000+max_w-1000/01.jpg) [2](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053829/http:/images.cdn.bigcartel.com/bigcartel/product_images/123834687/max_h-1000+max_w-1000/01.jpg) [3](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053829/http:/images.cdn.bigcartel.com/bigcartel/product_images/123834705/max_h-1000+max_w-1000/01.jpg), where you can find other critical letters such as "y", "M", "J" etc.

Any ideas?

Font: 

 Optimo Hermes 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053829/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: Strange Leafhopper

comments.content: It is indeed: Hermes with stylistic set 1. Thanks for the swift answer, Ryuk.
